head.supplied: 29/2/66 ¶ Dear Mr Moore ¶ ¶ Both Mr McCulloch & Mr Vernon are inclined to grant the request asked in the byefollowing letter. ¶ The hon. the Chief Secretary desired me to send a written application....

div.p: N66/2123, unit 179, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

29/2/66
M mis-dated this letter; the cover on the file notes that it was registered at the Chief Secretary’s Office on 28 February.

Both Mr McCulloch & Mr Vernon are inclined to grant the request asked in the byefollowing letter.
M to J. McCulloch, 28 February 1866 (in this edition as 66-02-28d). The hon. the Chief Secretary desired me to send a written application. Will you be so friendly to submit it formally as early as possible, that not a day of this dry weather may be lost for the earth work.
